description: Students examine a historical period or theme and its impact on the institutional, intellectual,
and artistic heritage of German-speaking societies. The course requires close reading and
critical analysis of primary sources, with a focus on history as an interpretive reconstruction of
the past. Recent topics: the German Democratic Republic, German colonialism and decolonization,
and migration. The course emphasizes strategies for writing papers in German. Taught
in German. May be repeated if topic is different. Offered periodically in fall semester.
